result.execSummary:
The defendant Fred L Pa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Prohibiting the possession of drug paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fred L Pa

records.addlTxt: 8:42 AM Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by phone/video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by phone/video for Fred L Pa. Atty. Dadoun states the Def wants to proceed to resolution and had been connected to this hearing by video prior to the Court's technical difficulties. DA - State moves to amend count 1 to county ordinance 90-5 and moves to amend count 2 to county ordinance 17-3; $10 plus costs requested on each count. So ordered. Atty. Dadoun offers no contest pleas for Def to the two counts as amended. Court accepts the pleas and finds Def guilty to both ordinances. Sentence ordered as requested - $10 plus costs on each count.
Status hearing on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on February 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:09 AM by Zoom. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Fred L Pa. Defendant Fred L Pa appeared by video means. Atty. McDougal requests AIA; wants to review the charges and the complaint; hasn't received the filed complaint at this point.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Appearances: Judge Sharp, SKK Court Reporter, DA Harper for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney McDougal

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$1,000 signature bond
Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance. No bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Defense/Defendant comments:
No objection to the signature bond but  object to the no drink provision.

Court Orders:
$1,000 Signature Bond
Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance. No bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Next Appearance set for 01/28/22 at 11 AM
